ray.rage.scene

Interface SkeletalEntity

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable, Entity, Managed<SceneManager>, Nameable, SceneObject, Visible
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GenericSkeletalEntity

    public interface SkeletalEntity
extends Entity
    A Skeletal Entity extends the notion of an Entity to add support for Skeletal animations using a skeleton, and a mesh.

    A skeletalEntity is the ultimate union of a skeleton and a mesh. A skeletal-entity also allows the user to load and play skeletal animations. It is the responsibility of the skeletal entity to properly apply the animation data contained in the animation class in order to yield the desired transformations. It is also the duty of the skeletal entity to handle the animation state and logic with the update() method. This method is intended to be called every frame, but that is not a requirement by design. SkeletalEntities are not meant to be created directly. Instead, you should use the SceneManager.createSkeletalEntity(String, String, String) factory method.

    Author:
    Luis Gutierrez
    See Also:
    Skeleton, Mesh, Animation
